Description.val:
The Family of Heavy Tactical Vehicles (FHTV) is designed for cross-country military missions to transport ammunition, petroleum, oils and lubricants, unit resupply, and other missions throughout the tactical environment to support modern and highly mobile combat units.  Systems include the Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck (HEMTT) and the Palletized Load System (PLS) which is currently in sustained production.  The HEMTT A4 and PLS A1 incorporate the Long Term Protection Strategy (LTPS) "B-Kit" Ready cab, a modern power train, independent front suspension, Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) and traction control, updated electrical system and climate control.  Both trucks utilize the companion PLS-trailer (A1) with Container Transfer Enhancement (CTE), and Enhanced Container Handling Units (E-CHU).  The HEMTT Light Equipment Transporter (LET) tractor is the primary recovery vehicle for the Modular Catastrophic Recovery System (MCRS) which is designed to recover catastrophically damaged Stryker's and Mine-Resistant Ambush-Protected (MRAP) vehicles.

The M1076 PLS trailer is used in conjunction with the PLS truck (M1074 and M1075 variants) as well as the HEMTT load handling system M1120 variant.  It accommodates a demountable cargo bed capable of hauling up to 16.5 tons of cargo/payload.  The M1076A1 trailer is equipped with the Container Transfer Enhancement (CTE).  This is used in conjunction with Enhanced Container Handling Unit (ECHU) equipped vehicles to allow the direct trans-load of an 8x8x20ft ISO containers from a truck to trailer without the need for an M1077 flat rack or additional Material Handling Equipment.

The Enhanced Container Handling Unit (E-CHU) is the latest model that provides the capability to pick-up and transport 20ft International Standards for Organization (ISO) containers without the use of a flatrack.  The E-CHU allows the Army to use its Tactical Wheeled Fleet in any number of ways in transporting loads and is common to both the Palletized Load Handling System (PLS) and Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Trucks (HEMTT) Load Handling System (LHS) vehicles.  The E-CHU allows for storage of the Front Lift Assembly when not in use and can still receive the M1077 flatrack/CROP and is fully operational with the PLS Trailer.

The Container Roll-in/out platform (CROP) is a flatrack suitable for use with the PLS and HEMTT Load Handling System (LHS).  It is compatible for transport on the PLS and HEMTT LHS Trucks and PLS Trailer, and capable of transport inside any International Standards for Organization (ISO) ICC Steel, dry cargo container.

The Modular Catastrophic Recovery System (MCRS) is designed to significantly enhance the Commander's ability to recover large wheeled vehicle platforms in severe off-road conditions either in lift/tow or transport mode. MCRS is comprised of the Prime Mover (M983A4 LET), Fifth Wheel Towing Recovery Device (FWTRD),  & the Tilt Deck Recovery Trailer (TDRT).  Coupled with the Prime Mover, MCRS is capable of recovering all Stryker variants and an estimated 95% of Mine Resistant Ambush Protected (MRAP) vehicles currently in theater.

The Heavy Equipment Transporter System (HETS) is comprised of the M1070A1 Tractor and M1000 Trailer and is used to transport, recover, and evacuate a combat loaded M1 Series main battle tank, an M88, or similar heavy loads.  The Heavy Equipment Transporter Systems (HETS) United States Army Europe (USAREUR) Operational Needs Statement (ONS # 17-22207) requirement is for Heavy Equipment Transport Systems by the first quarter of FY 2020 that shall be capable of carrying 78.5 Tons of payload and receive road permits at 75 Tons within the European Union.  The recommended course of action for satisfying the ONS is to utilize a modified version of the M1070A1 tractor combined with a new production commercial 8-axle trailer.  Per the 1 DEC 17 Army Requirements Oversight Committee (AROC), this trailer will be capable of carrying 85 tons. The AROC also directed an additional modification to the tractor that will allow it to achieve an ultimate carrying capacity of 85 tons.

The Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck Extended Service Program (HEMTT-ESP) is a Recapitalization program critical to upgrading the 11 Ton payload, 8 wheel drive HEMTT to include armor ready
capability as well as modernizing the aging fleet. The HEMTT-ESP remanufactures and upgrades 20+ year old HEMTT A0 vehicles and HEMTT A2 vehicles to the current A4 configuration. The HEMTT A4
has improved survivability with integrated under body A-Cab and a scalable B-Kit (common to the Palletized Load System (PLSA1)); a modern powertrain; upgraded suspension and electrical system and
incorporates an anti-lock brake system, air conditioning and traction control as standard on the platform. The HEMTT fleet is an essential combat enabler in all Brigade Combat Team (BCT) formations. This
program produces a like-new vehicle with a full new vehicle warranty.

The Army Acquisition Objective (AAO) for PLS Trailer (PLST-D08900) is 17,547, Container Roll-in/out Platform (CROP-D16100) is 57,104, Modular Catastrophic Recovery System (MCRS-D12389) is 161, Enhanced Container Handling Unit (ECHU-D16101) is 3,887, HEMTT ESP (HEMTT ESP DV0021) is 20,369, and USAREUR HETS ONS (HETS DV0012) is 170.

Justification.val:
FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $37.192 million supports a quantity of 409 M1076 Palletized Load System (PLS) trailers.  PLS trailers will fill Active Army and Army National Guard components requirements in support of Stryker and Modular Brigade Combat Teams (BCT) activations, Patriot Units, and Combat Engineers.  In FY 2018, the high Gross Weapon System Unit Cost on D08900 P5 is due to a low quantity from incorrectly adding paint and fabrication not required to the PLS Trailers unit cost.  The quantity in FY 2018 that will be procured is 700, with a corrected Gross Weapon System Unit Cost of 91.286.  The variation between FY 2019 Base and FY 2019 OCO Gross Weapon System Unit Cost is due to CROP being procured under D08900 at a lower unit price.  

FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $1.056 million supports a quantity of 68 Container Roll-in/out Platform (CROP).  The CROP will fill Active Army requirements in support of Stryker and Modular Brigade Combat Teams (BCT) activations.  The primary mission is cross-country movement of combat configured loads of ammunition and other classes of supply loaded on Flatracks or in ISO containers which is a critical element of resupply and other missions in the tactical environment to support modern and high mobile combat units.

FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $2.455 million supports a quantity of 28 Enhanced Container Handling Units (ECHU).  The ECHU will fill Active Army requirements in support of Stryker and Modular Brigade Combat Teams (BCT) activations, Patriot Units, and Combat Engineers.

FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $8.983 million supports a quantity of 25 Modular Catastrophic Recovery Systems (MCRS).  The MCRS will fill Active Army requirements to recover catastrophically damaged Stryker Combat Vehicles and Mine-Resistant Ambush-Protected (MRAP) vehicles.  Original MCRS AAO was established for the Stryker family of Vehicles however,  MCRS Army Acquisition Objective (AAO) was increased as the Army's Recovery Force Structure was revised.  Without MCRS assets, Commanders will lack the ability to successfully recover and evacuate catastrophically damaged MRAP and Stryker variants.  The Gross Weapon System Unit Cost in FY 2018 is incorrect due to an improper quantity on the P-40.  The quantity should reflect 19 which would lower the Gross Weapon System Unit Cost to 328.000.  

FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $87.582 million supports a quantity of 120 USAREUR HETS ONS trailers that will fill Active Army requirements to transport the M1A2 Abrams Main Battle Tank in the United States Army Europe (USAREUR) Area of Operation (AOR) and the Contractor Logistics Support required. An Operational Needs Statement (ONS # 17-22207) submitted by USAREUR and validated by G8 requests a solution to Heavy Equipment Transport Systems (HETS) to meet the increased payload requirements.  The USAREUR HETS ONS shall be capable of carrying 78.5 Tons of payload and receive road permits at 75 Tons within the European Union.  Per the 1 DEC 17 Army Requirements Oversight Committee (AROC), this trailer will be capable of carrying 85 tons. The AROC also directed an additional modification to the tractor that will allow it to achieve an ultimate carrying capacity of 85 tons.  Modifications required to the tractor will be executed through the Modification Line (DA0924).  Gross Weapon System Unit Cost in FY 2018 reflects prior course of action which included the price of a new production tractor and trailer.  The approved strategy is to only procure new trailers which reflects the lower unit cost in FY2019 and modify the tractors to meet the 85 ton capability. FY 2018 will procure a quantity of 50 HETS trailers.

FY 2019 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $0.837 million supports a quantity of 9 M1076 Palletized Load System (PLS) trailers.  PLS trailers will fill Active Army and Army National Guard components requirements in support of Stryker and Modular Brigade Combat Teams (BCT) activations, Patriot Units, and Combat Engineers.  The Product Office received funding on SSN 16400 to execute for PLS trailers.

FY 2019 OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $39.400 million supports a quantity of 467 PLS trailers for the Combatant Command (COCOM) requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries and support the European Deterrence Initiative (EDI).  Procurement is necessary to outfit the Pre-Positioned equipment set.  There is no excess inventory or viable substitute available to support the EDI requirements. 

FY 2019 OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $76.000 million supports the recapitalization of a total of 134 HEMTT M978A4 Tankers (Fuel Servicing Trucks) to the latest A4 configuration in support of Combatant Commands (COCOM) requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries and support the European Deterrence Initiative (EDI). This provisions the European Deterrence Initiative - Army Prepositioned Stock (APS) which supports the establishment of Armored Brigade Combat Teams (ABCT) for EDI. Procurement is necessary to outfit the Pre-Positioned equipment sets. There is no excess inventory or viable substitute available to support the EDI requirement. APS must be filled with trucks that meet armoring requirements.

The quantities in the DA0500 P-40 Resource Summary and Secondary Distribution Table have been temporarily suppressed in the database to avoid confusion between the Exhibits. The correct quantities for FY
2019 Base are as follows:
D08900 / PLS TRAILERS: 409 trailers
D12389 / MODULAR CATASTROPHIC RECOVERY SYSTEM (MCRS): 25 systems
D16400 / FORWARD REPAIR SYSTEM (FRS): 9 PLS trailers
DV0012 / HEAVY EQUIPMENT TRANSPORTER SYSTEM: 120 trailers
Total for FY 2019 DA0500: 533

The correct quantities for 2019 OCO are as follows:
D08900 / PLS TRAILERS: 467 trailers
DV0012 / HEMTT-ESP: 134 recap trucks
Total for FY 2019 DA0500: 601

System Engineering/Program Management (SEPM) includes PM and System Engineering oversight required to manage the program and provide contractor oversight. Salaries, Benefits, Travel, Personnel Training and other Government costs are included for retaining a professional acquisition workforce.

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

Name.val: Trailers, PLS - System Engineering Program Management

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val:
Unit costs are determined by range pricing at ceiling amount for each Ordering Year (OY) and reconciled after the delivery order (DO) is completed.

FY2017 PLS-T Unit Cost is at ceiling price and has not been reconciled.  
FY2018 PLS-T Unit Cost included an additional cost for fabrication and paint that is incorrect and will be reduced.
FY2019 PLS-T Unit Cost is based on OY4 pricing at ceiling.

Unit cost in FY2018 reflects prior course of action which included the price of a new production tractor and trailer.  The approved strategy is to only procure new trailers which reflects a lower unit cost in FY2019 and modify the tractors. Modifications required to the tractor will be executed through the Modification Line (DA0924).

OverallDeliveryScheduleRemarks.val: Currently no contractor has been selected.  The FY 2019 Production Rates are based on market research.  These figures will be updated once a contractor has been selected.
